plaintiffs.name: Jennifer Martinez
plaintiffs.residency: State of California, and San Francisco County
plaintiffs.consumer_status: Individual 'consumer' within the meaning of the FCRA

plaintiffs.name: Carlos Martinez
plaintiffs.residency: State of California, and San Francisco County
plaintiffs.consumer_status: Individual 'consumer' within the meaning of the FCRA

defendants.name: BANK OF AMERICA, N.A.
defendants.business_status: Duly authorized and qualified to do business in the State of California

factual_background.summary: Married couple disputing erroneous joint account information reported after identity theft incident affecting both spouses.

events.description: Plaintiffs opened joint checking account with Bank of America.
Identity thieves compromised joint account information.
Fraudulent overdraft fees created negative account status.
Both plaintiffs disputed the erroneous reporting with bank and credit agencies.
Bank of America verified the fraudulent information as accurate to Equifax.

additional_notes: Both plaintiffs were victims of the same identity theft incident
Bank acknowledged fraud but continued negative reporting
Both plaintiffs' credit scores negatively impacted

causes_of_action.title: VIOLATION OF THE FCRA
allegations: Defendants violated FCRA ยง 1681i and ยง 1681s-2(b) by failing to conduct reasonable investigations regarding both plaintiffs' joint account disputes.

damages.summary: Both plaintiffs suffered damage to their credit profiles, emotional distress, and were jointly denied for a mortgage application.

reasons: Negative banking history on both applicants
